Rules and Regulations: 
 
 There is an option between C or JAVA or C++ for Encoding and a team can opt for either 
 
of the languages. 
 
 Each team comprises of 1 or 2 members. 
 
 For the prelims there will be 30 questions and the time allotted is 30 minutes. 
 
 For each correct answer 2 marks will be allotted. 
 
 For each wrong answer 1 mark will be deducted. 
 
 An online prelim will be held for the direct entry to the final round (much tougher) . 
 
Final Round~ 
 
 The finals will take place in 2 rounds. 
 
 In round 1 an algorithm will be given to you, you need to write the code for that algorithm 
 
and get the desired output. The first round will be a 'lock n key' round where the output of 
 
the given program will be the key to unlock the immediate next question. 
 
 In the 2nd round you will be given 5 algorithms. Attempt whichever you want to,solve them, 
 
get the desired output and show it to us.
